content.question: The graphs below show changes in a population over time. The dashed line represents the carrying capacity of the species. Which of the following graphs best shows the population size of a K-selected species over time in a stable environment?

choices.label: The figure presents a line graph. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time” and the number 0 is indicated with an arrow pointing to the right. The vertical axis is labeled “Population Size” and the number 0 is indicated with an arrow pointing up. There is a dashed line near the top of the vertical axis. The curve begins a little above 0 on the vertical axis and curves steeply upward and to the right. The curve passes the dashed line and ends near the halfway point of the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a line graph. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time” and the number 0 is indicated with an arrow pointing to the right. The vertical axis is labeled “Population Size” and the number 0 is indicated with an arrow pointing up. There is a dashed line near the top of the vertical axis. The line begins at 0 on the vertical axis and curves upward and to the right crossing the dashed line at a point approximately halfway across the horizontal axis. The curve then moves downward and to the right, passing through the dashed line and ending at the rightmost end of the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a line graph. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time” and the number 0 is indicated with an arrow pointing to the right. The vertical axis is labeled “Population Size” and the number 0 is indicated with an arrow pointing up. There is a dashed line near the top of the vertical axis. The line begins at 0 on the vertical axis and curves upward and to the right, passing through the dashed line approximately halfway across the horizontal axis. The line then fluctuates up and down in three shallow loops, passing through the dotted line in each shallow loop.

The figure presents a line graph. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time” and the number 0 is indicated with an arrow pointing to the right. The vertical axis is labeled “Population Size” and the number 0 is indicated with an arrow pointing up. There is a dashed line near the top of the vertical axis. The line rigidly and steeply increases, and passing through the dotted line approximately one third of the way across the horizontal axis. The line then decreases steeply and approaches the lowest point on the vertical axis, before it shallowly increases and continues to fluctuate up and down well beneath the dotted line.

content.answer: The figure presents a line graph. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time” and the number 0 is indicated with an arrow pointing to the right. The vertical axis is labeled “Population Size” and the number 0 is indicated with an arrow pointing up. There is a dashed line near the top of the vertical axis. The line begins at 0 on the vertical axis and curves upward and to the right, passing through the dashed line approximately halfway across the horizontal axis. The line then fluctuates up and down in three shallow loops, passing through the dotted line in each shallow loop.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Describe patterns or trends in data.
